verbose_text: The pharmacokinetic studies, performed after intravenous (IV) administration of 4 mg/kg dose of curcumin in rats, have indicated that the amount of curcumin available in the brain was significantly higher for curcumin loaded NLCs (AUC 0-t = 505.76 ng/g h) as compared to free curcumin (AUC 0-t = 0.00 ng/g h) and curcumin loaded SLNs (AUC 0-t = 116.31 ng/g h) (P < 0.005) [XREF_BIBR].
